actions.in_committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Committee on Labor and Human Resources. Approved for reporting with amendments favorably.
Committee on Labor and Human Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Hatch under the authority of the order of Apr 13, 84 with amendments. With written report No. 98-401.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 782.
Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

official_title: A bill to amend the provisions of the Public Health Service Act relating to health maintenance organizations.
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Health Maintenance Organization Amendments of 1984 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to repeal support provisions for health maintenance organization (HMO) feasibility studies, planning, and initial development. Limits HMO initial operating or acquisition and construction loan and loan guarantee assistance to those HMOs receiving such assistance before FY 1985. Repeals the health system (planning) agency review requirement. Limits the Secretary of Health and Human Services' authority to borrow from the Treasury to cover loan guarantee defaults to those guarantees issued before FY 1984. Repeals the HMO Federal requalification requirement. Requires annual (presently quarterly) updating of State HMO law digests. Repeals the provision stating that only title XIII (Health Maintenance Organizations) funds may be used for HMO development. Repeals specified annual reporting requirements. Authorizes FY 1985 through 1987 training and loan fund appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to amend the provisions of the Public Health Service Act relating to health maintenance organizations.
